title: Joshua Chapter 14 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Joshua chapter 14 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Joshua Chapter 14 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Joshua Chapter 14.

questions.question: Who were responsible for distributing the land of Canaan among the children of Israel?
options: Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the tribes
questions.correctAnswer: Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the tribes
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:1 states that Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the tribes distributed the land of Canaan.

questions.question: How was the inheritance of the land divided among the tribes?
questions.correctAnswer: By lot
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:2 explains that their inheritance was determined by lot, as commanded by the LORD through Moses.

questions.question: Which tribes received their inheritance on the other side of the Jordan River?
options: Two tribes and a half tribe
questions.correctAnswer: Two tribes and a half tribe
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:3 states that Moses gave the inheritance of two tribes and a half tribe on the other side of Jordan.

questions.question: Which tribe did not receive an inheritance of land among the children of Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Levites
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:3 clarifies that the Levites were given no inheritance among the other tribes.

questions.question: What did the Levites receive instead of land?
options: Cities to dwell in with suburbs for cattle and substance
questions.correctAnswer: Cities to dwell in with suburbs for cattle and substance
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:4 states the Levites were given cities to dwell in along with their suburbs for cattle and substance.

questions.question: Who came to Joshua in Gilgal and spoke about the promise made by the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Caleb the son of Jephunneh
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:6 records that Caleb the son of Jephunneh came to Joshua in Gilgal to remind him of the LORD’s promise.

questions.question: How old was Caleb when Moses sent him to spy out the land?
questions.correctAnswer: Forty years old
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:7 states Caleb was forty years old when Moses sent him to spy out the land.

questions.question: What did Caleb say about his heart when he brought back the report of the land?
options: He brought back the report as it was in his heart
He was afraid of the people living there
questions.correctAnswer: He brought back the report as it was in his heart
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:7 states that Caleb brought back the report of the land as it was in his heart.

questions.question: What was the reaction of Caleb's brethren when they went up to spy out the land?
options: They made the heart of the people melt
questions.correctAnswer: They made the heart of the people melt
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:8 says Caleb’s brethren made the heart of the people melt.

questions.question: What did Moses swear concerning the land Caleb walked on?
options: It shall be Caleb's inheritance forever
It shall be given to Joshua
It shall be shared by all tribes
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be Caleb's inheritance forever
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:9 records that Moses swore the land Caleb walked on would be his inheritance forever.

questions.question: True or False: Caleb was 85 years old when he spoke to Joshua about receiving his inheritance.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:10 states Caleb was 85 years old when he made his request to Joshua.

questions.question: True or False: Caleb said his strength to go to war was weaker now than when Moses sent him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:11 says Caleb’s strength was as strong at 85 as it was when Moses sent him.

questions.question: True or False: Caleb requested the mountain where the Anakims lived because he believed the LORD would help him drive them out.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:12 records Caleb’s request for the mountain where the Anakims lived, trusting the LORD’s help.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Joshua blessed Caleb and gave him __________ for an inheritance.
questions.correctAnswer: Hebron
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:13 states that Joshua gave Caleb Hebron for his inheritance.

questions.question: What was the former name of Hebron?
questions.correctAnswer: Kirjatharba
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:15 says Hebron was formerly called Kirjatharba.

medium.title: Joshua Chapter 14 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Joshua Chapter 14 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with discouragement after years of waiting for God's promises to be fulfilled. Based on Caleb's example in Joshua 14, what biblical truth would you share about perseverance and faith?
options: Faithfulness to God leads to receiving His promises even after many years
Waiting means God has forgotten your prayers
Strength fades with age, so rely on others
Promises are only for the young and strong
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness to God leads to receiving His promises even after many years
questions.explanation: Caleb trusted God's promise for 45 years and received his inheritance because he wholly followed the LORD (Joshua 14:6-10, 14). His strength remained for war and he was blessed for his faithfulness (Joshua 14:11-13).

questions.question: How does Joshua 14 teach about integrity and honesty in leadership when distributing inheritance?
options: They followed God's command precisely and distributed by lot
Leaders gave land based on favoritism
Inheritance was sold to the highest bidder
They ignored God's instructions and chose randomly
questions.correctAnswer: They followed God's command precisely and distributed by lot
questions.explanation: The children of Israel, led by Eleazar, Joshua, and the tribal heads, gave inheritance by lot as the LORD commanded through Moses (Joshua 14:1-2, 5). This shows obedience and integrity in leadership.

questions.question: Based on Joshua 14, what does Caleb's story teach about wholehearted devotion to God?
options: Wholly following the LORD leads to blessing and fulfillment
Partial obedience is sufficient for God's favor
God rewards only strength, not faith
questions.correctAnswer: Wholly following the LORD leads to blessing and fulfillment
questions.explanation: Caleb was rewarded because he wholly followed the LORD God of Israel, resulting in receiving Hebron as his inheritance (Joshua 14:9, 14).

questions.question: A believer is feeling physically weak and unable to serve God effectively. What encouragement does Joshua 14:11 provide about serving God despite age or physical challenges?
options: God can sustain strength for service regardless of age
Only youth can serve God effectively
Physical strength is irrelevant to faith
Service is not necessary in old age
questions.correctAnswer: God can sustain strength for service regardless of age
questions.explanation: Caleb, at 85 years old, declared his strength was as great as when he was 40, showing God can sustain believers for service even in old age (Joshua 14:10-11).

questions.question: What practical lesson about trusting God's promises can be learned from Caleb's request for the mountain inhabited by the Anakims?
options: Trusting God empowers believers to face difficult challenges
Avoid difficult tasks even if God promises victory
Promises require no action from us
Fear should prevent us from pursuing God's plans
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting God empowers believers to face difficult challenges
questions.explanation: Caleb asked for the mountain with large, fortified cities because he trusted the LORD would enable him to drive out the Anakims as promised (Joshua 14:12).

questions.question: How does Joshua 14 illustrate the importance of obedience to God's instructions in the life of the community?
options: The Israelites divided the land exactly as the LORD commanded Moses
They ignored God's instructions and divided land by personal choice
Obedience was optional for the tribes
questions.correctAnswer: The Israelites divided the land exactly as the LORD commanded Moses
questions.explanation: The chapter states that the children of Israel obeyed the LORD's command through Moses and divided the land accordingly (Joshua 14:5), showing communal obedience.

questions.question: True or False: According to Joshua 14, the Levites received a portion of land inheritance just like the other tribes.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The Levites received no land inheritance but were given cities to dwell in with surrounding pasture for their livestock (Joshua 14:3-4).

questions.question: True or False: Caleb's faith was a result of his own strength and not related to following God.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Caleb's faith and strength resulted from wholly following the LORD God, not his own strength alone (Joshua 14:8-9, 11-14).

questions.question: A believer wants to serve God faithfully throughout life. How does Caleb's example in Joshua 14:10-11 encourage perseverance?
options: Perseverance and strength can be sustained by God over many years
Service to God is only for the young and strong
It is normal to weaken and stop serving God
Faithfulness depends solely on physical ability
questions.correctAnswer: Perseverance and strength can be sustained by God over many years
questions.explanation: Caleb's declaration that his strength remained as strong as when he was younger shows God can sustain believers for faithful service throughout life (Joshua 14:10-11).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Caleb was given _______ as his inheritance because he wholly followed the LORD God of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: Hebron
questions.explanation: Joshua blessed Caleb and gave him Hebron as his inheritance because of his wholehearted faithfulness to God (Joshua 14:13-14).

questions.question: How does the distribution of land by lot in Joshua 14 teach us about fairness and trust in God's provision?
options: Using lots ensures impartiality and reliance on God's will
Leaders chose land based on personal preferences
Land was distributed to the wealthiest tribes
The children of Israel ignored God's instructions
questions.correctAnswer: Using lots ensures impartiality and reliance on God's will
questions.explanation: The inheritance was distributed by lot as commanded by the LORD through Moses, showing trust in God's sovereignty and fairness (Joshua 14:2, 5).

questions.question: What does Joshua 14 teach about the relationship between faith and action when Caleb decided to claim the mountain of the Anakims?
options: Faith in God motivates courageous action to overcome obstacles
Faith requires no action, only waiting
Fear should prevent taking risks even if God promises victory
questions.correctAnswer: Faith in God motivates courageous action to overcome obstacles
questions.explanation: Caleb expressed confidence that if the LORD was with him, he could drive out the Anakims, showing faith leads to bold action (Joshua 14:12).

questions.question: A church leader wants to teach about God's faithfulness. How does the story of Caleb in Joshua 14 demonstrate God's faithfulness over time?
options: God kept His promise to Caleb after 45 years of waiting
Faithfulness depends on human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: God kept His promise to Caleb after 45 years of waiting
questions.explanation: Caleb reminded Joshua that God had sworn the land he walked on would be his inheritance forever, and God kept this promise even after 45 years (Joshua 14:9-10).

questions.question: How can Joshua 14 inspire believers to remain faithful in trials and challenges?
options: Remaining wholly devoted to God leads to victory and blessings
Giving up is acceptable when trials persist
Success depends on human strength alone
questions.correctAnswer: Remaining wholly devoted to God leads to victory and blessings
questions.explanation: Caleb's faithfulness and wholehearted following of God during wandering and battles led to receiving his inheritance and strength for war (Joshua 14:6-9, 11-14).

questions.question: What does the mention of Hebron formerly being Kirjatharba teach us about God's power over formidable obstacles?
options: God enables His people to overcome even strong enemies
Strong enemies are impossible to defeat
Names of places do not change
God only helps in peaceful times
questions.correctAnswer: God enables His people to overcome even strong enemies
questions.explanation: Hebron was previously Kirjatharba, a city of the Anakims, a great and powerful people, yet God gave the land rest from war through Caleb (Joshua 14:15).

hard.title: Joshua Chapter 14 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Joshua Chapter 14.

questions.question: Who were responsible for distributing the land of Canaan among the children of Israel?
options: Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes
questions.correctAnswer: Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:1 states that Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes distributed the land.

questions.question: How was the inheritance of the land assigned to the tribes of Israel?
options: By lot, as the LORD commanded by Moses
By a vote among the tribes
questions.correctAnswer: By lot, as the LORD commanded by Moses
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:2 explains that the land was distributed by lot as the LORD commanded through Moses.

questions.question: Which tribes received their inheritance on the other side of the Jordan River?
options: Two tribes and a half tribe
None, all tribes inherited land west of Jordan
questions.correctAnswer: Two tribes and a half tribe
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:3 mentions that Moses gave the inheritance of two tribes and a half tribe on the other side of Jordan.

questions.question: Why did the Levites not receive an inheritance of land?
options: Because the children of Joseph had two tribes, so Levites only received cities to dwell in
They were given land outside Canaan
They were excluded due to disobedience
questions.correctAnswer: Because the children of Joseph had two tribes, so Levites only received cities to dwell in
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:4 explains that since Joseph's descendants formed two tribes, the Levites were not given land, only cities with suburbs.

questions.question: Caleb reminded Joshua of a promise made by Moses regarding his inheritance. What was Caleb's age when Moses sent him to spy out the land?
questions.correctAnswer: Forty years old
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:7 states that Caleb was forty years old when Moses sent him to spy out the land.

questions.question: What was the reaction of Caleb's brethren when they spied out the land, according to Caleb's report?
options: They made the heart of the people melt
questions.correctAnswer: They made the heart of the people melt
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:8 says that Caleb's brethren caused the people's hearts to melt with fear.

questions.question: What guarantee did Moses give Caleb for the inheritance of the land he had walked on?
options: That the land where his feet trod would be his and his children's forever
That he would become king over Israel
That he would receive double the land
That he would be exempt from war
questions.correctAnswer: That the land where his feet trod would be his and his children's forever
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:9 records Moses swearing that the land Caleb walked on would be his inheritance forever.

questions.question: At what age did Caleb request the mountain from Joshua, demonstrating his continued strength?
questions.correctAnswer: Eighty-five years old
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:10 shows Caleb stating he is eighty-five years old and still strong.

questions.question: What was Caleb's reasoning for asking for the mountain where the Anakims dwelt?
options: If the LORD is with him, he could drive out the Anakims despite the great cities
He wanted to test his strength against the Anakims alone
He sought to build a fortress there
He desired the land for its fertile soil
questions.correctAnswer: If the LORD is with him, he could drive out the Anakims despite the great cities
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:12 describes Caleb's confidence that with the LORD's help he could drive out the Anakims and take the cities.

questions.question: What inheritance did Joshua give to Caleb after his request?
questions.correctAnswer: Hebron
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:13 states Joshua blessed Caleb and gave him Hebron as his inheritance.

questions.question: Why did Hebron become Caleb's inheritance according to this chapter?
options: Because he wholly followed the LORD God of Israel
Because he was the eldest son
Because he conquered it by himself
Because it was the largest city
questions.correctAnswer: Because he wholly followed the LORD God of Israel
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:14 explains that Hebron was given to Caleb because of his wholehearted following of God.

questions.question: What was the former name of Hebron and who was Arba in relation to that city?
options: Kirjatharba; Arba was a great man among the Anakims
questions.correctAnswer: Kirjatharba; Arba was a great man among the Anakims
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:15 states Hebron was formerly Kirjatharba, named after Arba, a notable man among the Anakims.

questions.question: Following the distribution of the land, what was the state of the land according to the final verse of the chapter?
options: The land had rest from war
The land was still in turmoil
The land was contested by other nations
questions.correctAnswer: The land had rest from war
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:15 concludes that the land had rest from war after the inheritance was given.

questions.question: True or False: The Levites received a full territorial inheritance alongside the other tribes.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:3-4 clarifies that the Levites received no territorial inheritance but only cities with suburbs.

questions.question: Caleb’s faithfulness is an example of which biblical theme that is developed throughout Scripture?
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness and reward
questions.explanation: Caleb’s unwavering faith and the promise of inheritance reflect the biblical theme where faithfulness to God results in blessing, a motif seen throughout Scripture.

theological.title: Joshua Chapter 14 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Joshua Chapter 14 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: How was the land of Canaan distributed among the tribes of Israel according to Joshua 14?
options: By lot, as commanded by the LORD through Moses
questions.correctAnswer: By lot, as commanded by the LORD through Moses
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:2 states that the inheritance was given by lot, as the LORD commanded through Moses. This reflects God's sovereign provision and distribution of the land, consistent with divine justice and order (Numbers 26:55-56; Deuteronomy 16:18; Acts 1:26; Psalm 16:6).

questions.question: Which tribe did not receive an inheritance of land among the Israelites?
questions.correctAnswer: Levi
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:3 explains that the Levites received no land inheritance but were given cities to dwell in with their suburbs for their livestock. This aligns with their unique priestly role as mediators and servants of God’s sanctuary (Numbers 18:20-24; Deuteronomy 10:8-9; Hebrews 7:5; 1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: What was the significance of Caleb's request for the mountain where the Anakims dwelt?
options: He wanted a peaceful place to retire
He desired to prove his strength and faith in God's promise
He sought to build a temple there
He requested it as a reward for his wealth
questions.correctAnswer: He desired to prove his strength and faith in God's promise
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:12 shows Caleb's faith and confidence that the LORD would help him drive out the Anakims. This reflects the principle of trusting God’s promises for victory over giants and adversaries (Numbers 13:30; 1 Corinthians 10:13; Hebrews 11:33; Psalm 18:29).

questions.question: What does Caleb’s continued strength at age 85 demonstrate about God’s sustaining power?
options: Human strength can last without God
God sustains those who faithfully follow Him, enabling them for His purposes
Strength is irrelevant in spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: God sustains those who faithfully follow Him, enabling them for His purposes
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:10-11 reveals Caleb's vitality as a testimony to God's sustaining grace. This illustrates God's providential care for His faithful servants (Isaiah 40:29-31; Psalm 73:26; Philippians 4:13; 2 Corinthians 12:9).

questions.question: Why was Hebron given to Caleb as an inheritance?
options: Because he was the eldest son of Judah
Because he wholly followed the LORD God of Israel
Because he was a great warrior without faith
Because Joshua wanted to honor him
questions.correctAnswer: Because he wholly followed the LORD God of Israel
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:14 states Caleb received Hebron because of his wholehearted faithfulness to God. This underscores the biblical principle that obedience and faithfulness lead to divine blessing (Deuteronomy 28:1-2; 1 Samuel 15:22; Hebrews 11:6; James 2:17).

questions.question: What does the giving of the land 'by lot' symbolize theologically?
options: God's sovereign control over the distribution
questions.correctAnswer: God's sovereign control over the distribution
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:2 highlights that the land was distributed by lot according to the LORD’s command, symbolizing God’s sovereign authority over His people’s inheritance (Proverbs 16:33; Acts 1:24-26; Psalm 22:28; Romans 8:28).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Caleb said he was __________ years old when Moses sent him to spy out the land.
questions.correctAnswer: Forty
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:7 records Caleb's age as forty when he was sent to spy. This shows the longevity of God’s faithfulness from youth to old age, paralleling God's promises of sustaining His servants (Psalm 92:12-14; Isaiah 46:4; 2 Timothy 4:6-8; Psalm 71:18).

questions.question: What was the original name of Hebron, the city given to Caleb?
questions.correctAnswer: Kirjatharba
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:15 states that Hebron was formerly called Kirjatharba, named after Arba, a notable Anakite. This reflects how God’s people transformed regions formerly occupied by giants, showing His power over enemies (Genesis 23:2; Numbers 13:22; Psalm 78:51; Colossians 2:15).

questions.question: What role did Eleazar the priest play in the inheritance of the land?
options: He led the armies into battle
He helped distribute the land among the tribes
He chose the land for himself
questions.correctAnswer: He helped distribute the land among the tribes
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:1 mentions Eleazar’s role along with Joshua and tribal leaders in distributing the land, emphasizing the priestly function in God's covenant administration (Numbers 34:17-23; Joshua 18:1; Hebrews 7:23-25; Leviticus 25:23).

questions.question: Which tribes received their inheritance on the other side of the Jordan?
options: Two tribes and a half tribe
questions.correctAnswer: Two tribes and a half tribe
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:3 states Moses gave the inheritance of two tribes and a half tribe on the other side of Jordan, referring to Reuben, Gad, and half of Manasseh, showing God's faithfulness in fulfilling promises despite geographical separation (Numbers 32:1-5; Joshua 1:12-15; Hebrews 11:13; Acts 7:45).

questions.question: What was the consequence of Caleb 'wholly following the LORD'?
options: He was given a large army
He received a specific inheritance and blessing
questions.correctAnswer: He received a specific inheritance and blessing
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:9 and 14 highlight that Caleb’s wholehearted devotion resulted in a promised land inheritance and blessing, illustrating the principle that faithfulness to God brings reward (Deuteronomy 7:9; Psalm 37:4; Matthew 25:21; Revelation 2:10).

questions.question: Why did the children of Joseph not receive land for the Levites in their territory?
options: Because they were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, so no additional land was allotted to Levites
Because they refused to give land
questions.correctAnswer: Because they were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, so no additional land was allotted to Levites
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:4 explains that since Joseph's descendants were divided into two tribes, no extra land was given to Levites there, only cities to dwell in, reflecting God's provision for priestly needs without territorial inheritance (Numbers 35:1-8; Deuteronomy 18:1-2; 1 Chronicles 6:54-81; Hebrews 7:11).

questions.question: What theological truth is illustrated by the fact that Caleb’s brethren made the heart of the people melt, but he wholly followed the LORD?
options: Human fear contrasts with divine faithfulness
People are always united in belief
questions.correctAnswer: Human fear contrasts with divine faithfulness
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:8 contrasts the fearful report of Caleb’s brethren with Caleb’s wholehearted obedience to God, showing the tension between human doubt and trusting God’s promises (Psalm 27:1; Isaiah 41:10; Hebrews 10:23; Romans 4:20-21).

questions.question: Which statement best captures the eschatological hope reflected in Caleb’s inheritance?
options: Faithful perseverance leads to a promised rest
Military conquest is the ultimate salvation
Land ownership is irrelevant to God’s plan
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful perseverance leads to a promised rest
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:15 concludes with the land having rest from war, symbolizing the rest promised to God’s people, an eschatological theme echoed in Hebrews 4:1-11 where faithful perseverance leads to entering God’s rest.

questions.question: What does Joshua’s blessing of Caleb and giving him Hebron symbolize in the broader biblical narrative?
options: Transfer of authority and fulfillment of God’s promise
questions.correctAnswer: Transfer of authority and fulfillment of God’s promise
questions.explanation: Joshua 14:13 shows Joshua blessing Caleb and granting inheritance, symbolizing God’s faithfulness in fulfilling covenant promises through faithful servants, a theme consistent with biblical narratives of divine covenant (Genesis 12:7; 2 Samuel 7:16; Psalm 89:34; Luke 1:72-73).
